p: This review has highlighted the importance of considering the mental health of healthcare workers who are caring for patients during a viral outbreak. Although psychological distress is to be expected in situations where staff are under pressure to look after a large number of potentially infectious patients, employers can help to mitigate this by immediate implementation of several effective interventions. And despite the wide range of settings and types of viral outbreaks, these interventions are similar and thus highly applicable to the current covid-19 outbreak. Broadly the interventions concern communication, access to adequate personal protective equipment (PPE), adequate rest, and both practical and psychological support.
